dialogue2.0.phrases1: Coming from a noble family in the upper town of SteamLock, a merchant father and a diplomatic mother, I like to think that I lived my first happy and cherished years...
dialogue2.0.phrases2: Can we have the short version? The one where we know how you ended up here.
dialogue2.0.phrases3:
Ah, the impatience of youth... 
Engaged at FactoryTech an annual cycle earlier, my mission was to improve and repair the machines. But, not supporting the use of slaves, I rebelled by liberating some poor souls. 

My gesture put me in an unfortunate position and I was locked up here waiting for my resignation.
dialogue2.0.phrases4: Why didn't they put you in a classic cell with a wheel?
dialogue2.0.phrases5: Officially, for reasons of privilege, I am above all nobility! \n\nUnofficially, it's to keep me from escaping. I'm the one who designed what you call "classic cell."

dialogue4.0.phrases1: Well, it's been a pleasure, Stale. \n\nWe have a lot of things to do if you can tell us the exit...
dialogue4.0.phrases2:
Of course, of course. 

To get out, you just have to take the elevator and then, from the outside, reach the building at the back. 

That being said, I strongly advise against it, without a weapon you will not be able to fight the guards, let alone the SS. It is not two or three guards serving meals and bringing unconscious prisoners into their cells that will frighten us! In addition to the guards, who are armed and trained, FactoryTech is equipped with a Security System (or SS) to prevent looters from taking control of the factory. I would not advise you too much to equip yourself heavily before any attempt to escape. Yes, but this system keeps people from getting in and out! The SS protects against unauthorized entry and exit. Even the guards can't get out without permission. 
I think it's just in case a looter managed to infiltrate the guards. 

You should go see the prisoners I released, I'm sure they'll be happy to help you.

dialogue5.0.phrases1: There are two underground prisons. In the other prison, I freed the prisoners and taught them to open their cells from the inside. \n\nAs long as they keep the wheels spinning, the guards won't come to see what's going on.
dialogue5.0.phrases2: You think they can help us get out of here?
dialogue5.0.phrases3: It seems to me that some of them also want to escape. Maybe they have a plan?
dialogue5.0.phrases4: And how do we get to the other prison?
dialogue5.0.phrases5: Nothing could be easier. For the other prison, all you have to do is take the elevator and then, from the outside, reach the second elevator and get off.
